Condition.Expression: S_SECURE & SEM_SIMPLEREQUEST_$IpInstanceCH0 & !(REQUEST_LPDMACH0=DMA_REQUEST_SW) & ( (SEM_IP_ADC4_$IpInstanceCH0 & ADC4_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_DAC1_$IpInstanceCH0 & DAC1_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_I2C3_$IpInstanceCH0 & I2C3_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_SPI3_$IpInstanceCH0 & SPI3_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_LPUART1_$IpInstanceCH0 & LPUART1_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_ADF1_$IpInstanceCH0 & ADF1_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_LPTIM1_$IpInstanceCH0 & LPTIM1_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_LPTIM3_$IpInstanceCH0 & LPTIM3_SECURE)) & !S_LPBAM_CONF

S_SECURE & SEM_SIMPLEREQUEST_$IpInstanceCH1 & !(REQUEST_LPDMACH1=DMA_REQUEST_SW) & ( (SEM_IP_ADC4_$IpInstanceCH1 & ADC4_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_DAC1_$IpInstanceCH1 & DAC1_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_I2C3_$IpInstanceCH1 & I2C3_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_SPI3_$IpInstanceCH1 & SPI3_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_LPUART1_$IpInstanceCH1 & LPUART1_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_ADF1_$IpInstanceCH1 & ADF1_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_LPTIM1_$IpInstanceCH1 & LPTIM1_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_LPTIM3_$IpInstanceCH1 & LPTIM3_SECURE)) & !S_LPBAM_CONF

S_SECURE & SEM_SIMPLEREQUEST_$IpInstanceCH2 & !(REQUEST_LPDMACH2=DMA_REQUEST_SW) & ( (SEM_IP_ADC4_$IpInstanceCH2 & ADC4_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_DAC1_$IpInstanceCH2 & DAC1_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_I2C3_$IpInstanceCH2 & I2C3_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_SPI3_$IpInstanceCH2 & SPI3_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_LPUART1_$IpInstanceCH2 & LPUART1_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_ADF1_$IpInstanceCH2 & ADF1_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_LPTIM1_$IpInstanceCH2 & LPTIM1_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_LPTIM3_$IpInstanceCH2 & LPTIM3_SECURE)) & !S_LPBAM_CONF

S_SECURE & SEM_SIMPLEREQUEST_$IpInstanceCH3 & !(REQUEST_LPDMACH3=DMA_REQUEST_SW) & ( (SEM_IP_ADC4_$IpInstanceCH3 & ADC4_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_DAC1_$IpInstanceCH3 & DAC1_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_I2C3_$IpInstanceCH3 & I2C3_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_SPI3_$IpInstanceCH3 & SPI3_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_LPUART1_$IpInstanceCH3 & LPUART1_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_ADF1_$IpInstanceCH3 & ADF1_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_LPTIM1_$IpInstanceCH3 & LPTIM1_SECURE)| (SEM_IP_LPTIM3_$IpInstanceCH3 & LPTIM3_SECURE)) & !S_LPBAM_CONF

RefParameter.Name: RECAP_LPDMACH0
RefParameter.Description: DMA is not intended to hardware support the case of simultaneous enabled channels incorrectly configured with a same hardware peripheral request signal, and there is no user setting error reporting.

RefParameter.Name: RECAP_LPDMACH1
RefParameter.Description: DMA is not intended to hardware support the case of simultaneous enabled channels incorrectly configured with a same hardware peripheral request signal, and there is no user setting error reporting.

RefParameter.Name: RECAP_LPDMACH2

RefParameter.Name: RECAP_LPDMACH3
RefParameter.Description: DMA is not intended to hardware support the case of simultaneous enabled channels incorrectly configured with a same hardware peripheral request signal, and there is no user setting error reporting.

PossibleValue.Comment: The TC (and the HT) event is generated at the (respectively half) end of each block

Condition.Diagnostic: MEMTOMEM has to be used carefully while accessing an IP register as a source or destination. We Advice you to use MEM to Periph or Periph to Mem instead, when possible

PossibleValue.Comment: Right Aligned padded with 0 up to destination data width when src data width smaller than dest data width
Right Aligned Left Truncated down to destination data width when src data width bigger than dest data width

Right Aligned padded with 0 up to destination data width when src data width smaller than dest data width

Trigger of the selected DMA request on the falling edge of the selected trigger event input
A block transfer is conditioned by (at least) one hit trigger
A repeated block transfer is conditioned by (at least) one hit trigger
A single/burst transfer is conditioned by (at least) one hit trigger
The TC (and the HT) event is generated at the (respectively half) end of each block
The TC (and the HT) event is generated at the (respectively half) end of each linked-list item
The TC (and the HT) event is generated at the (respectively half) end of the last linked-list item
